metadata.title: CVE-2022-20154 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
In lock_sock_nested of sock.c, there is a possible use after free due to arace condition. This could lead to local escalation of privilege withSystem execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed forexploitation.Product: AndroidVersions: Android kernelAndroid ID:A-174846563References: Upstream kernel

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-20154` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-22-generic - 5.15.0-22.22
linux-image-5.15.0-22-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-22.22
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-22-generic - 5.15.0-22.22
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-22-generic-64k - 5.15.0-22.22
No subscription required
